Based on the user's preference cues, I would recommend "Pan' s Labyrinth". The movie is set in a fictional Spanish province during the Spanish Civil War (1936-1939)). 

The plot revolves around the story of a stepdaughter named Eliza who lives with her sadistic stepfather called Captain Antonio de Marquez. 

When Captain Antonio de Marquez becomes the ruler of the Spanish province during the Spanish Civil War, he orders Eliza to be killed. However, just when it looks like Captain Antonio de Marquez is going to succeed in executing Eliza's plan of escape, Eliza actually manages to change her mind and end up deciding instead to kill Captain Antonio de Marquez. 

Thus, "Pan' s Labyrinth" truly provides the audience with a mesmerizing story filled with suspense, drama, and even some unexpected twists and turns that are truly worth watching on screen.
